DOC.HEAD: Coleman Announces Deal To Sell Heating and Air Conditioning Division
DOC.TEXT: A Canadian company has agreed to buy the heating and air conditioning division of the Coleman Co., Coleman said Wednesday. A Coleman spokesman said the financial terms of the deal with Beacon International Ltd. of Toronto wouldn't be announced. The transaction is scheduled to be completed in early 1990. Beacon International is a subsidiary of Beacon Capital Corp., a small holding company. Coleman officials said the 650 workers in the division likely won't notice much change under the new owner. There had been fears a Coleman competitor would buy the division and move it or close it. In addition to a Wichita plant with more than 1 million square feet of manufacturing and office space, the division has a smaller factory employing 96 workers in Nacodoches, Texas, and a distribution center in Tornoto. Gross division sales in 1988 were $124.8 million. Coleman has been trying to sell the division and several other units since Wall Street investor Ronald O. Perelman acquired the company from the Coleman family earlier this year. In November, Coleman's Crosman Products unit was sold for $41 million to an investor group that included senior managers from the division. A tentative deal for the sale of the Coleman Camping Trailers division is awaiting finalization.
